definition: to live in harmony/to get along with each other
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
amicable/harmonious
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Mrs…has never really got on with her daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 老太太从未与儿媳妇儿真正和睦相处过。

sentences.english: They can never get along with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们永远无法彼此和睦相处。

sentences.english: Most daughter-in-laws can get along with their mother-in-laws.
sentences.chinese: 大多数媳妇都能与婆婆和睦相处。

sentences.english: Mrs…and her daughter-in-law have never really got on.
sentences.chinese: 老太太从未与儿媳妇儿真正和睦相处过。

sentences.english: Would he be comfortable and get along with the other kids and this teacher?
sentences.chinese: 他能和其他孩子及老师和睦相处吗？

sentences.english: They tend to get along well with the average American.
sentences.chinese: 他们易于与普通美国人和睦相处。

sentences.english: Love your work, and students live in harmony.
sentences.chinese: 你热爱劳动，与同学和睦相处。

sentences.english: Here Adam lived in peace with all the animals.
sentences.chinese: 在这里亚当和各种动物和睦相处。

sentences.english: Xiamen has a fine tradition to respect the nature. Here man and nature are living in harmony.
sentences.chinese: 厦门人有崇尚自然的传统，人与自然在这里和睦相处。

sentences.english: Oracle does not have a tradition of playing well with others.
sentences.chinese: 甲骨文并没有一个与其他公司和睦相处的传统。

sentences.english: He found himself in harmony with his new workmates.
sentences.chinese: 他很快发现自己与新同事能和睦相处。

sentences.english: Can tegus get along with other pets like dogs or cats?
sentences.chinese: 泰加能和猫猫狗西城绿锦狗和睦相处吗？

sentences.english: I am speaking, of course, of men inclined to be in harmony with themselves.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我说的是那些倾向于与自身和睦相处的人。

definition: peaceful coexistence of nations, societies etc
to coexist/to get along (with others)
peaceful relations/harmonious
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
family-like close relationship (idiom)
to live together in harmony
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
polite and amiable
harmony is to be prized
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to yield to one another/mutual accommodation
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
to forget former enmity (idiom)
